document_name_accent: benh dau day than kinh sinh ba.json
subsection_content:
Trigeminal neuralgia can come from many causes:
Due to blood vessel compression: blood vessels press on the trigeminal nerve, causing wear or damage to the protective covering around the nerve (myelin).; Due to medical condition: TN symptoms can also occur in people with multiple sclerosis (a disease that causes deterioration of the myelin sheath of the trigeminal nerve). Rarely the symptoms of TN are caused by nerve compression from a tumor, or a plexus of arteries and veins called an arteriovenous malformation.; Due to trauma: Damage to the trigeminal nerve (which can be the result of sinus surgery, oral surgery, stroke or facial trauma) is also considered a cause of facial pain.
